page.title: 10WILDLIFE
page.content: The area around here is full of wildlife. In the woodland area fallow and muntjac deer can be found, which originally escaped from large country parks. They now roam freely over farmland causing a lot of destruction to both crops and young trees. The farmer encourages game birds such as pheasants and partridges by leaving grain for food and providing plenty of ground cover in the woodland areas for nesting. The shoots take place in the winter months. The Essex Hunt usually visits each village during the winter, fox hunting. Unfortunately a lot of our rabbits still suffer from the killer disease myxomatosis. Almost all the old hedgerows are left intact and they in themselves shelter an abundance of plant and animal life.
